channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Kaitlyn Younger applied to five Ivy League schools, plus Stanford and Berkeley, with a 1550 on her SAT. None accepted her. https://t.co/l3Tr8cyitX
The border city of Tijuana, Mexico has become an unexpected gateway for thousands of Ukrainians and Russians fleeing the war in hopes of crossing north to start a new life https://t.co/exFYAcDOyu

The first French president to secure a second term since 2002, Emmanuel Macron now faces deep divisions among voters worried about inflation and the impact of immigration on France’s national identity https://t.co/ea1QLSUGV9
From @WSJopinion: Is it the end of Russia’s empire? Moscow has a stake in the Ukraine war that is greater than Putin’s career, writes @wrmead https://t.co/8a3Z71Z7hy
French President Emmanuel Macron was re-elected Sunday, according to projections based on early ballot counts, defeating far-right leader Marine Le Pen https://t.co/o2BfC3BeUQ
Twitter is re-examining Elon Musk’s $43 billion takeover bid after he lined up financing, a sign the company may be more open to a deal, people familiar say https://t.co/ojJqHledR1
The U.S. holds one sanctions card close to the vest: Vladimir Putin's alleged girlfriend and the mother of at least three of his children, the government says. https://t.co/9KkC906nKI
The physical damage to Ukraine’s infrastructure and buildings is estimated by the World Bank at $60 billion so far https://t.co/4qsH69uWgI

Ukrainians celebrated Orthodox Easter in the shadow of war against Russia Sunday, with the conflict set to soon enter its third month: “We all pray that the Lord would help each of us achieve victory over the aggressor." https://t.co/MC9ugwJd9J

President Volodymyr Zelensky is set to receive U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin in Ukraine to discuss military assistance as Russian forces build up for an offensive in the east of the country https://t.co/ZSfK8mbFVV
Essay: Rediscovered interviews with Hong Kong leaders in the 1980s shed new light on the British handover that led to China’s oppressive rule of the city. https://t.co/6ydQncih81
Saudi royals have sold more than $600 million worth of real estate, yachts and artwork since Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman tightened the ruling family’s purse strings https://t.co/kktkjyrxq3
A four-story office building in Bucha was one of the first sites where Ukrainians were questioned, tortured, killed or detained, according to residents and officials https://t.co/6PsntKkTpu
Some 8,000 luxury cars bound for Russia are at the Port of Zeebrugge in Belgium as authorities there navigate a maze of sanctions on Moscow over its Ukraine invasion https://t.co/nF9CTybmcu
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine spurred a strong Western response in imposing sanctions. But their outcome is as difficult to predict as that of the war itself. https://t.co/qooHFZaGm8

Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis approved a bill to terminate special tax status allowing Disney to govern the land housing its theme parks. Here's how the district came to be more than 50 years ago. https://t.co/9twwnp3Fuy
A.J. Jacobs went to CIA headquarters on a not-so-secret mission: to solve Kryptos, a code-bearing sculpture that inspires thousands of online sleuths https://t.co/aoqr1SEHMm
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/RmCVrys1d1 https://t.co/MPyViZ8xen
Former GOP Sen. Orrin Hatch, who played a pivotal role in tax, civil-rights and healthcare legislation over more than four decades, has died at 88 https://t.co/41G3k42Q2i

As Stephen Colbert was hatching his CBS program, he said he consciously conceived it to be a show about love, but “of course, you can’t say that out loud, because it sounds a little pretentious” https://t.co/GOdcbGp2jh

From @WSJopinion: Putin and his supporters need to understand that if he detonates a nuclear weapon in Ukraine, the U.S. response will be swift and significant, writes @robertcobrien https://t.co/Rj3lDcEIX0

For months, managers have called three days in the office a week a hybrid-work ideal that both gives employees flexibility and packs in enough face time to cement company culture. For some, the three-day plan is morphing into two. https://t.co/h4BGovoVRx
Kyiv says it needs around $5 billion a month in budgetary support for up to five months and $600 billion for a broader rebuilding effort https://t.co/Bti5gePqSL
TikTok brain is real, researchers say, and it’s affecting kids’ brain development. "We’ve made kids live in a candy store." https://t.co/NfKh7YTYpP
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/odRFuOgWNY
Stewing resentment over a government lockdown in Shanghai is bolstering a fringe idea: independence for China’s most cosmopolitan city https://t.co/eiOwcrTMNu

Ever tried a lab-grown chicken sandwich? Upside Foods, which raised $400 million, is one of several startups hoping to gain U.S. regulatory approval for lab-grown meat products. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/XPFAtkINth https://t.co/sUPlxTYqx5

How did Ukraine transform from a rigid Soviet-style military to a Westernized force? Years of NATO classes, drills and exercises. https://t.co/xqlLlBN1EL

Twitter is expected to reject Elon Musk’s $43 billion bid to buy the company as too low. If that really was his “best and final” offer, as he has said, a tender offer would be his next-best option. Here’s what that means. https://t.co/CCMkCiS04L
A Russian blackout of data on government and trade, among other categories, makes it harder for the West to know if sanctions are working https://t.co/vR3nJsmaIV

Russia ramped up oil shipments to key customers in recent weeks, defying its pariah status in world energy markets. One increasingly popular method for delivery: tankers marked “destination unknown.” https://t.co/75FsyAWFfq
President Volodymyr Zelensky has warned that Russia has its sights set on other European countries beyond his own https://t.co/tRj09smoY8

The blacklist—which covers products such as semiconductors, telecommunications equipment, lasers, avionics and maritime technologies—has left the Russian military struggling to find parts for tanks, satellites and rocket launching systems. https://t.co/Ld7YydFtxC

Marine Le Pen’s far-right French party is paying nearly $13 million to a contractor that is currently under U.S. sanctions, part of a settlement involving a previous loan from a Russian bank https://t.co/PEoDXf1MNx
A $75 Queen Elizabeth II Barbie released this week sold out on the Mattel Creations website in eight hours https://t.co/j36BmD93JN
Russia’s war in Ukraine is likely to accelerate Europe’s adoption of renewable energy https://t.co/mrXTlXZzRb
The Dow suffered its worst decline of the year, falling 2.8% to cap its fourth straight week of losses https://t.co/6KkHdik3z3

Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signed into law Friday a bill that would terminate a special tax district that has allowed Disney to govern the land housing its theme parks for over 50 years https://t.co/WsMrUTjNPa
Recent photos reveal the suffering of residents inside Mariupol, a once-thriving Ukrainian city now under Russian siege https://t.co/jADEpBN9TC
From @WSJopinion: Voters would be grateful if Biden stopped talking down to them and learned to be straightforward, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/T4JwrN45L8

GOP Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene testified Friday that she tried to rally supporters to challenge the election result on Jan. 6, 2021, but didn’t know some would riot in an attempt to block the certification of President Biden’s win https://t.co/aZaVVs79wR

From @WSJopinion: The Disney lesson for CEOs is to stay out of these divisive cultural fights. The lesson for political partisans in the workplace is that their bosses run the office, but they don’t run the country. https://t.co/XaRHlnLGkZ

Marine Le Pen’s far-right French party is paying nearly $13 million to a contractor that is currently under U.S. sanctions, part of a settlement involving a previous loan from a Russian bank https://t.co/e5pEef29lu
